tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Excellent service, quality and professionalism displayed by Dr Shaikh across multiple procedures and check ups.

I went to him Initially for a wisdom tooth removal, and then later for cavities.

I had cavaties which were almost going to be two root canals, other dentists were insisting on root canals even though i wasn't in pain, but Dr Aashiq explained the situation very well, spent lots of time in diagnosis and explanations and then saved me from a root canal, and instead very skillfully removed the cavity which was touching the tooth nerve. The process of filling and cosmetically re-shaping filling was done in such a way that no one can make out that anything was ever wrong with that area. 

Cavity removal and filling on two back teeth was painless and done within an hour in one single sitting.

Root canal was a difficult one, it took 3+ hours, and my case had a high risk of nerve damage, he explained the entire thing before hand along with where and how I would feel pain,  the procedure was mostly painless, with the unavoidable exception of  a few of the times that the nerve was pinched as the tooth was slowly taken out.
reply_text:
Thank you a lot for sharing your experience in such a fantastic way and appreciating the efforts that we take to save our patients teeth in every manner possible.
And moreover you have also been a fabulous patient and cooperative as well all through the procedure.
We find ourselves fortunate enough to have been got a chance to treat patients of your calibre.
Hope you have a healthy and happy life..üòÉ

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: Absolutely terrible experience. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend anyone going to Dr. Aashiq at all after the experience I‚Äôve had. I went to him because i had severe toothache due to an unfinished root canal done by my previous dentist. I was given 2 options of either extracting the tooth or attempting a re-root canal by the dr after looking at an x-ray that he took on the spot. I asked him what he recommended and he said that he would want me to give him a chance to save the tooth and so i did and we started the procedure immediately. I was prescribed anti inflammatorys and a painkiller ******* *** to be taken 3 times a day for 5 days. These 5 days were the most painful days of my life. After this when i went back to him i had a huge hard and painful swelling on my jaw which showed that i did have infection and that I should have been prescribed antibiotics for the same. ******* ** ******** *** ********** i was recommended to do an extraction and place an implant as soon as we extract the tooth to save time. Since I didn‚Äôt want to lose my tooth i called up my family dr right after getting out of that clinic and told him the entire scenario* * *** **** **** **** ** ***** **** *** ********** **** ************* *** ****** *** **** ** ** **** ********* ****** *** ****** *********** *** * **** *** **** ** * ****** **** ** ************ It took me 3 days to recover from the pain but i still have a huge swelling filled with puss and infection. This was my experience with Dr. Aashiq and i feel the readers are smart enough to know what is best for them.
reply_text:
Thanks a lot for blaming us and negatively recommending us for wrong things done by your previous dentist.
Your previous doctor had broken an root canal cleaning instrument right at the apex of your tooth root while doing root canal procedure which definitely will cause you pain whether we prescribe antibiotics or not. 
We clarified this right at the time of consultation itself and gave you two options whether to extract or to give it a chance and save it. We mutually agreed to at least try and save it thinking it might work with your consent of course and explained you the possible pros and cons clearly.
What does informed consent mean?
Unfortunately your pain didn‚Äôt subside as we had expected. So as discussed at the consultation appointment the other option was the only thing left to be implemented i.e extracting the tooth.
And this is what informed consent means.
But this option didn‚Äôt go down your throat when the time arrived for it. You shouldn‚Äôt have agreed upon for it at the first appointment itself and denied any sort of treatment at our clinic if you were not ready to get the tooth removed if the first option doesn‚Äôt work.
You being a smart clever and well educated girl such a puerile behaviour was not expected at all especially after discussing each and every detail before hand.
As far as medications are concerned the doctor had cleared his stand on that day itself that until and and unless the source of infection (i.e the broken instrument) is either removed or bypassed completely or disinfected effectively the infection will recur again and again periodically ultimately transforming into a big abscess which might hurt you even more may be not today but surely some day later. This is what more than 13 years of experience of our expert doctor concludes.
Instead of thanking the doctor that he tried to save your tooth that too without even charging his fees for it, you are inappropriately recommending others not to go to him? He himself even personally messaged you the following day when the procedure was performed to know about your wellbeing. But you and your father didn‚Äôt even show any respect for the doctor. That proves your immaturity and arrogance anyhow.
We are practising in this city since 13 years and encounter a lot of good calibre and high profile cases daily so performing treatments without prior consent is not at all our preference no matter whatever the situation would be. We never ever compromise on the standards and quality for that matter and we even charge for it extra if needed. 
We have tons of patients walking in and out but None of them have ever complained such a thing in past except you in these years.


Having said that we still hope the best for you in future and pray to Almighty for your complete recovery soon üòä 
May you stay blessed happy and healthy always..!!

review:
It's always a good feeling to visit Dr. Shaikh for our dental problems. Ever since we hav been visiting him the worries that we used to take for dental issues hav gone .
We trust him like our own family members.
He is very honest and friendly and does treatment excellently in 1st appointment itself.
His diagnosis is perfect all the time. No doubt in it
Moreover he has got excellent staff that adds cream on the top of the cake that Dr. Shaikh bakes.
Keep doing the good work and thank you for the outstanding service üòÉ
reply_text:
Thank you for such beautiful and appreciating words. You also have been a fabulous patient to work upon.
I hope you stay happy and blessed always!!!!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Wait time,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Very satisfactory treatment received.
Dr. Shaikh and his team really work hard for their patient's well being and good health.
I had a major issue with my upper jaw which required surgery. His expert team team planned and treated my infection which almost destroyed my upper jaw. And now I am relieved of the extreme pain and discomfort that I was in.
I am thankful to him after GOD almighty ofcourse that this disease was cured successfully and in time.
I recommend to all of you have any issue related to your teeth and jaws please at least visit him once. His explanation made me very much comfortable to undergo the treatment which I feared a lot before.
Happy and satisfied patient
reply_text:
Thank you Mr. Mustafa for sharing your feedback is such a lovely manner. I feel very much overwhelmed and blessed to be able to help in your health crisis. The credit goes to you also in successfully treating the ailment you had as you trusted me and cooperated very well without any question.
I wish you good health from here onwards and you stay happy alwaysüòÉ

context: Gum Disease Treatment/ Surgery,Bleeding Gums Treatment,
review:
I had bleeding gums issues for the past several years and I didn‚Äôt find any proper  solution for the problem. I visited Dr. Aashiq‚Äôs clinic and found his treatment advice very logical and convincing and we immediately agreed.

It‚Äôs been almost more than 2 years and now after the surgery my problem has been solved completely. We are very happy with the treatment we got and we recommend him strongly.

Secondly i would like to praise the staff as well as they were very kind and helpful throughout. I have found that in other clinics the staff is not that much concerned nor caring and not even soft-spoken.
And lastly the clinic environment is also calm and soothing to everyone. Very nicely designed.

Overall very nice experience and excellent treatment.
Keep up the good work.!!
reply_text:
Thank you for appreciating our work in such a wonderful way.
And we also feel glad that you liked our clinic design and the staff's gestures in serving you the best.

We hope you stay safe and healthy üòÉ

context: Cosmetic/ Aesthetic Dentistry,RCT - Root Canal Treatment,
review:
We have been visiting Dr. Shaikh for 8 years now and he has been providing ********* treatment to us everytime.

He advises clear cut and best treatment options which fits our requirements and gives us relief from the ailments.
Good and friendly environment in clinic and the staff is also welcoming and gives us reminder of appointments a day before the scheduled time. They also give us a follow up call after the procedure has been done and enquire about our well being, I have not seen this being followed at any other hospitals.

The managing system really is very good and convenient for everyone.
We strongly recommend him to all those who are looking for advanced and high quality treatments with international standards.

review: Dr Shaikh who I met in an emergency situation !(triggered due to severe pain due Locked Jaw - the diagnosis was as per self acquired knowledge from internet)  As the Clinic was open on Sunday, I  took an appointment, the Doctor after examination explained the probable reasons but assured that it doesn't look like a case of Locked Jaw, he prescribed  pain killer and muscle relevant . An Dental XRay was suggested before next follow up visit which on subsequent follow up visit ruled out any major issue.The clarity of Dr Shaikh was amazing and I found him very approachable and patient centric in his approach. PKRoy, Seawoods
reply_text: Thank you for sharing your experience..!üòÉ

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,Wait time,
context: RCT - Root Canal Treatment,Composite tooth filling,
review:
It was an amazing experience with Dr. Aashiq as my dental phobia was totally eliminated forever which was with me since ages.
He is very very humble and polite and perfect in his work.
He explained me the root canal procedure in detail and informed me the steps involved. I hardly felt any sort of pain not even discomfort for that matter. He had placed a rubber sheet which prevented water and the chemicals used for root canal treatment getting into my mouth and made my experience totally comfortable. I had never seen any other doctor using this rubber sheet anywhere else.
Very dedicated and passionate doctor who really cares for his patients.
And to top that up he has a very overwhelming and welcoming staff who guided me before and after the procedure as to what care should be taken after the procedure.
All together I recommend him strongly and wish him very good luck in future.
:-)
reply_text:
Thanks a lot for sharing your experience in such a wonderful way ma'am..!! üòÉ

I hope you stay healthy and happy always!!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review:
Very clean, well kept clinic - everything was good except the exorbitant cost - cleaning charge was 2500Rs, Tooth extraction - 2000Rs. How can middle class families afford it.

No wonder folks don't take preventive care.
reply_text:
Thank you for the appreciation. We at Digital Dental World strive hard to provide our patients the best quality treatment with international standards.

As far as the exorbitant cost is concerned we would prefer to improve our treatment standards day by day rather than degrading it just to be economical. We encounter patients of that calibre who need quality and painless treatment with modern techniques and world class precision. 
And moreover your tooth was already root canal treated way back and was badly mutilated which would have required surgical intervention otherwise. Fortunately it was removed with the normal method.
But still we would surely take your suggestion on a serious note and try to improve in future.
Thank you üòä
